CatDescriptText: Cutline of related images published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1953, pg. 11 reads: "Links' Cotton Parade Terrific Hit - One of the most enchanting evenings of song and fashion swept into Pittsburgh last Friday night [ at A. Leo Weil School], when the Pittsburgh Chapter of the Kinks, Inc., presented "Cotton of Parade," a combined musicale and summer style show, featuring Rose V. Murray of Houston, Tex., the 1953 "Spirit of Cotton Makers Jubilee." Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1953, reads: "'Spirit of Cotton' - Rose V. Murray of Houston, Tex., the 1953 'Spirit of Cotton Makers Jubilee,' has been captivating audiences throughout the extensive tour, which has taken her and her chaperone, Mrs. R. Q. Venson of Memphis, Tenn., to a dozen states. Last week they were in Pittsburgh, Pa., where the local Links, Inc., presented her as the star in 'Cotton on Parade,' a musicale and fashion show combined. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of three women, including Jessie Vann, and Rose V. Murray, wearing dark coat and corsage, standing in hallway of A. Leo Weil school for Cotton on Parade fashion show
CatSubject_tab: Group portraits--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Flowers--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Doors--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.A. Leo Weil Elementary School (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Vann, Jessie, 1889-1967.
